common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch crash due to AVX2 dependency
common_issues.description: PiecesOS versions 11.1.0 and 11.1.1 encounter launch crashes on certain hardware configurations, particularly those lacking AVX2 support. This issue affects macOS and Windows users. The Pieces team has addressed this in version 11.1.2, urging users to upgrade for resolution.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation 

**Key Points Raised:**

* User 'gonzososa' reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching on macOS (Arm architecture) after updating to 11.1.0.
* The issue is related to the new vector library requiring AVX2 support, which is not available on older CPUs (pre-2016/2017).
* This issue affects users with older CPUs.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS was not working on macOS (Arm architecture) after updating to 11.1.0 due to a lack of AVX2 support on older CPUs.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces team released a new version (11.1.2) with a fix for the AVX2 issue.
* This new version allows users with older CPUs to run PiecesOS on macOS (Arm architecture).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved with the release of PiecesOS version 11.1.2.
* Users with older CPUs can now run PiecesOS on macOS (Arm architecture).
* User 'gonzososa' confirmed that the fix worked for them.

**Additional Notes:**

* This issue is related to another issue reported by user 'hra42'.
* The Pieces team is aware of the issue and is working on a solution.

**Overall, the issue has been resolved with the release of PiecesOS version 11.1.2. Users with older CPUs can now run PiecesOS on macOS (Arm architecture).**

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## GitHub Conversation Summary: Pieces App Support Issue

**Key Points:**

- User @GetReal444 had issues booting up the Pieces application.
- Support agent @mark-at-pieces requested logs and technical information.
- The issue was related to a failing dependency of AVX2 vector library on certain platforms, affecting multiple users.
- A solution was implemented and released in a new version (11.1.2) of Pieces OS.

**Current Status:**

- Issue resolved for the affected user after upgrading to 11.1.2 version.

**Outcome:**

- Pieces team identified and addressed the issue promptly, releasing a fix within a few days.

PiecesOS was unable to launch.

Desktop Application

Windows

latest

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces OS not launching (2025-02-11)

**Key Points:**

* User reports Pieces OS not launching.
* Pieces Support Bot suggests related issues and resources.
* Mark-at-pieces requests user to provide support logs.
* Tsavo-at-pieces notes an upcoming release related to this issue.
* Mark-at-pieces confirms the release and suggests user update to 11.1.2 version.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS 11.1.1 has stricter hardware requirements than initially communicated.
* This causes launch issues for some users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update Pieces OS to version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A fix is included in Pieces OS 11.1.2, released on 2025-02-13.
* Mark-at-pieces asks the user to update and share feedback.

**Overall:**

This issue involves compatibility challenges with Pieces OS 11.1.1 and suggests updating to a newer version, 11.1.2, for resolution.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS boot-up and launch issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing slow boot-up times, launch failures, and errors related to core dependencies in PiecesOS. This is primarily affecting macOS and Windows users. The issue seems to stem from recent updates, particularly versions 11.1.1 and later. Proposed solutions include updating to the latest version (11.1.2), providing support logs, and reinstalling PiecesOS.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation

**Subject:** PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up (cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)

**Key points raised:**

* Some users are experiencing issues with PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up or not running at all.
* The issue seems to be related to the migration of data during a major update.
* Some users are reporting success after updating to version 11.1.1, while others are still experiencing problems.

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up or doesn't run at all.
* The system tray icon for PiecesOS is not visible.
* Users are unable to connect to the Pieces for Developers Desktop application.
* A webpage is launched warning that PiecesOS couldn't start and suggesting a restart, but restarting doesn't resolve the issue.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The PiecesOS team has released version 11.1.1 which is supposed to resolve the issue for most users.
* Users are suggested to uninstall and reinstall PiecesOS if they are still experiencing issues.
* The PiecesOS team is investigating why some users are still having problems with version 11.1.1.
* A patch will be shipped in the next build to prevent the migration of files/folders from OneDrive/Documents.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Version 11.1.1 has been released and appears to have resolved the issue for many users.
* The PiecesOS team is still investigating why some users are still experiencing problems.
* A patch to prevent the migration of files/folders from OneDrive/Documents will be shipped in the next build.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue seems to be primarily affecting Windows users.
* Users are encouraged to provide additional information, such as logs and screenshots, to help the PiecesOS team diagnose the issue.

* C2mokete created an issue regarding the "PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up" problem.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the proper Pieces team member.
* The bot suggested related issues and helpful resources for C2mokete to explore.
* Mark-at-Pieces informed C2mokete about the recently released version 11.1.2 of PiecesOS that might address the boot-up issue.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS took a long time to boot-up, making it unusable.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-Pieces suggested C2mokete try the newly released PiecesOS version 11.1.2 to see if it resolves the boot-up issue.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* It is unclear whether C2mokete tried the suggested solution or experienced any improvement. 
* Further communication or updates are needed to determine the final outcome. 

**Overall, the issue highlights the problem of slow boot-up times in PiecesOS and the potential solution offered by the recent software update.**

common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch after update
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch, often after an update, on Windows and macOS.  The issue seems related to stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1 and data migration issues.  Updating to version 11.1.2, which includes a fix, is recommended.  Uninstalling and reinstalling PiecesOS is also suggested as a potential solution.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS launch failures
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to launch, often after updates, on macOS and Windows.  Issues involve core dependencies, hardware requirements, and data migration. Solutions include reinstalling with correct architecture, updating to the latest version (11.1.1 or 11.1.2), and providing logs for support.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
##  Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Problem:** PASimmons encountered an issue where Pieces for developers couldn't run on their M1 Mac.

**Key points:**
* The issue was automatically routed to the Pieces team.
* The support agent suggested various troubleshooting steps, including killing related processes, checking logs, and ensuring the correct build for their architecture was installed.
* PASimmons confirmed they had an M1 chip and reinstalled Pieces for developers using the Apple Silicon download link provided.

**Solutions:**
* Reinstalling Pieces for developers with the correct architecture (Apple Silicon in this case).

**Outcome:**
* The issue was resolved after PASimmons reinstalled Pieces for developers using the correct build.
* The support agent confirmed the resolution and linked to an ongoing announcement about the issue. 
* The conversation was closed.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Unresponsive and Freezing
common_issues.description: Users report the Pieces Desktop app becoming unresponsive or freezing on macOS and Linux. Issues include premature saving of conversation titles, failure to boot up after updates, and frequent freezing. Solutions involve software updates, disabling on-screen keyboards (Linux), and reinstallation.

related_issues.title: Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
related_issues.text:
Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I click on the title of Conversation in the Desktop app, I can edit it as expected but it will update save the input before I'm done editing.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** Renaming conversations in Pieces app exhibited "odd behavior."

**Key Points:**

* User @seantiz reported the issue.
* Support bot acknowledged and routed the issue.
* @mack-at-pieces confirmed the issue and promised a fix.
* A patch was released in v3.3.5 and 3.3.6 of the copilot & desktop app.
* @seantiz confirmed the issue was resolved after updating.

**Solutions:**

* A patch was released to address the issue.

**Outcome:**

* The issue with renaming conversations has been resolved.

**Current Status:**

* The issue is closed.

Pieces app goes unresponsive and freezes a lot when trying to do anything, like trying to type in copilot chat or navigating through the menus. Can't use pieces app at all! Tried reinstalling it, but it made no difference. Desktop app version is 3.3.6

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User `94tejas` reported the Pieces app freezing on Linux Mint.
* `pieces-support-bot` acknowledged the issue and suggested workarounds.
* `mack-at-pieces` identified the issue as related to Flutter's TextFields on Linux Mint.
* Disabling the on-screen keyboard was a temporary solution. 

**Solutions:**

* Disabling the on-screen keyboard in accessibility settings.
* An upcoming Flutter hotfix is expected to fix the issue permanently.

**Outcome:**

* The user's issue was resolved by disabling the on-screen keyboard.
* The Pieces team is monitoring the situation and will update the app with the Flutter hotfix when available.
* The issue remains open for future updates.

**Note:** This summary provides a concise overview. Please refer to the original conversation for complete details.

Monitor the effectiveness of the 11.1.2 update in resolving the reported launch and boot-up problems and communicate proactively with users about its status.
Gather more detailed logs and diagnostics from users experiencing issues to help identify the root causes and develop targeted solutions.
Provide clear and concise instructions on how to provide support logs and report issues effectively.
Explore ways to improve the stability and performance of the Pieces Desktop app on Linux, potentially in collaboration with the Flutter community.
Review and update the PiecesOS installation process to ensure users are installing the correct architecture (Apple Silicon vs. Intel) for their macOS devices.
